entry.title: Malicious prosecutions, how Scotland works when it comes to football
entry.summary: Imran Ahmad, one of the founding fathers of Newco Rangers, was yesterday awarded £600k damages for malicious prosecution. entry.title: ‘I COULDN’T BE HAPPIER,’ ANGE A YEAR AGO
entry.summary: CELTIC celebrated a 2-1 League Cup victory over Ibrox opposition at Hampden exactly a year ago today. The first piece of silverware of the season was claimed after Kyogo Furuhashi had fired a double behind Allan McGregor as Ange Postecoglou picked up his third honour in his short reign as Hoops manager. The previous season [...]

entry.title: WELCOME TO PARADISE, MARTIN: PART FIVE
entry.summary: ON SATURDAY, May 26 2001, the sun beamed brightly on Hampden and Martin O’Neill as he brought down the curtain on his history-equalling first season as Celtic manager. Only the legendary Jock Stein had achieved the domestic clean sweep before in the Hoops’ history – and he did it twice, in seasons 1966/67 and 1968/69. [...]
